item.description:
Ok, you're right.  It is all about me. If you want to choose the exhibits, you can organize your own event.

Here's what I'd like to see:

Ori Gersht
History Repeating
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/ori-gersht


Mario Testino
In Your Face
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/mario-testino

The Postcard Age
Selections from the Leonard A. Lauder Collection
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/postcard-age

and
Edward Weston
Leaves of Grass
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/edward-weston-1

This event occurs during Member Guest Days, when members can bring up to four additional guests, beyond what their membership allows. This means I can bring five guests.

If there are other members around who can bring guests, let me know and I'll hook you up with someone who needs a ticket. Of course, I encourage you to support the museum, and buying a membership is an excellent way to do so -- you can get into all the Friday night social events, and also go to most other museum functions, and gain free admission any day the museum is open. What a bargain!! Some memberships start to pay for themselves after three admissions.

Regular adult admission is $25, but you may also be able to borrow passes from your local library.

 

Let's meet in the lobby, in front of the statue of Orpheus and Cerberus, and let's go see the exhibitions that I want to see.  Of course, this is still a free country, pending the results of the election, and you can also look at some of the exhibitions you would like to see.  I won't stop you.
item.name: MFA - see the exhibits Ron wants to see
